Package oh_hecc.game_parts.component_editing_windows

Class GenericEditorWindow

java.lang.Object
oh_hecc.game_parts.component_editing_windows.GenericEditorWindow
All Implemented Interfaces:
EditorWindowInterface
Direct Known Subclasses:
MetadataEditorWindow, PassageEditorWindow
public abstract class GenericEditorWindow extends Object implements EditorWindowInterface
A superclass for both of the editor window classes (because they both use all these things)

    • addWindowClosedListener

      public void addWindowClosedListener​(Runnable closeEvent)
      Adding a WindowClosed event listener via a Runnable functional interface
      Specified by:
      addWindowClosedListener in interface EditorWindowInterface
      Parameters:
      closeEvent - the functional interface holding the Runnable that needs to be run when this window is closed.
      See Also:
      Runnable

    • isPassageNameRegexValid

      private void isPassageNameRegexValid​(JTextComponent passageNameComponent)
      This can be called for either of the JTextComponents that are used for passage names (start passage/current passage name). If the current text for them isn't a valid passage name (doesn't satisfy PASSAGE_NAME_REGEX), the text will be red. Otherwise, the text will be same as default. The text colour will only change if the validity of the JTextComponent's contents changes.
      Parameters:
      passageNameComponent - the JTextComponent that will be holding the text that might be a passage name.

    • addPassageNameDocumentListener

      void addPassageNameDocumentListener​(JTextComponent passageNameComponent)
      Creates a DocumentListener that can be used on the passage name JTextComponents, which can call isPassageNameRegexValid when it's edited, and adds it to aforementioned JTextComponent's document
      Parameters:
      passageNameComponent - the component itself that this will be listening to/will need to update
